name: Homemade Chili Powder

ingredients.name: ancho
ingredients.original_string: 4 ancho or 8 dried New Mexico chiles, stemmed and seeded

ingredients.name: dried hot chile
ingredients.comment: like chile de árbol,  stemmed and seeded
ingredients.original_string: 1 dried hot chile, like chile de árbol, stemmed and seeded, or cayenne to taste

ingredients.name: dried oregano
ingredients.original_string: 2 tablespoons dried oregano, preferably from Mexico

instructions: Combine the whole chiles and cumin seeds in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook, shaking the pan occasionally, until lightly browned and fragrant, just a few minutes; for the last minute of cooking, add the oregano.

Cool, then grind in a spice or coffee grinder to a fine powder; add cayenne at this stage if you’re using it (some cooks also put in a bit of garlic powder). Store in a tightly covered opaque container for up to several months.
